intro: Nigella arvensis var. glaucescens, commonly known as the blue hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. The seed pods are cylindrical and split open to release small, dark seeds when mature.
